Knowledge Design

  • Structure the Data – define formats and standards.
  • Build Ontologies – establish meaning and relationships.
  • Interrogate the Datasets – evaluate biases, gaps, and context.

Materials

Data

For the first activity, review these different archival sources and imagine that you need to design a data model for a tabular database (a spreadsheet). What variables/columns would you include?

  • Stock book Sample
  • Catalogue Raisonné Sample
  • Exhibition Catalogue Sample
  • Correspondence Sample

Presentation

You can follow the presentation here.

Presentation

Bibliography & Resources

Data Feminism — Catherine D’Ignazio & Lauren F. Klein (2023). MIT Press. https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/

CARE Principles for Indigenous Data Governance — Global Indigenous Data Alliance (2019). https://www.gida-global.org/care — Principios CARE para pueblos indígenas.

Data Epistemologies, the Coloniality of Power, and Resistance — P. Ricaurte (2019). Television & New Media, 20(4), 350–365. https://doi.org/10.1177/1527476419831640

Linked Art — Linked Art Community (s. f.). https://linked.art/ — Modelo de datos e interoperabilidad para arte.

CIDOC-CRM, Version 7.3 — CIDOC CRM Special Interest Group (s. f.). https://cidoc-crm.org/Version/version-7.3

The FAIR Guiding Principles for scientific data management and stewardship — Mark D. Wilkinson, Michel Dumontier, IJsbrand Jan Aalbersberg, Gabrielle Appleton, Myles Axton, Arie Baak, et al. (2016). Scientific Data, 3, 160018. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2016.18

W3C PROV: Provenance Documentation — W3C (s. f.). https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-overview/ — Modelo de procedencia (PROV).
